meanings.definition: A plant native to hot, dry regions, typically having thick fleshy leaves and spikes of yellow flowers.
meanings.sent1: The agave in the desert stores water in its thick leaves to survive.
meanings.sent2: People admire the beauty of agave plants in arid climates.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cactus invite the agave to the party? Because it was a succulent affair!
meanings.sent4: The agave stood tall like a guardian of the desert, its spikes gleaming in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The agave's fleshy leaves glistened with moisture, a precious resource in the dry land.

meanings.definition: A sweet syrup or nectar obtained from the agave plant, used as a sweetener or in the production of alcoholic beverages.
meanings.sent1: The agave syrup added a delightful sweetness to the dessert.
meanings.sent2: Bartenders often use agave nectar in cocktails for a unique flavor.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pancake go to therapy? It had a sticky relationship with agave syrup!
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed like agave nectar, soothing and comforting to all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The agave nectar dripped slowly, like golden honey from a magical plant.
